abstract: <jats:p><jats:italic>Elachista dimicatella</jats:italic> Rebel, 1903, has so far been considered a species in Europe with restricted distribution from Ukraine to western France. The species occurs on mountainous regions. However, the in-depth analysis of a taxonomically uncertain species of <jats:italic>Elachista</jats:italic> from the Cottian Alps (Italy), especially through DNA barcoding and subsequent morphological studies, led to the realization that individuals previously identified as <jats:italic>E. dimicatella</jats:italic> from the Cottian Alps and the Pyrenees were misidentified. According to our research, a total of three species can be differentiated: <jats:italic>E. dimicatella</jats:italic> from Carpathians and its former junior synonym <jats:italic>E. niphadophanes</jats:italic> Meyrick, 1937, <jats:bold>sp. rev.</jats:bold>, from the Pyrenees, as well as the newly described <jats:italic>E. cottiella</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold> from southwestern Alps, hitherto incorrectly identified as <jats:italic>E. dimicatella</jats:italic>. Diagnostic features of the three species are discussed and illustrated. <jats:italic>Elachista dimicatella</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>E. niphadophanes</jats:italic> are redescribed.</jats:p>
title: Elachista dimicatella sensu auctt.—a complex of neglected species diversity (Lepidoptera, Elachistidae) from European mountain systems
